measured_by: NPI-15 (short form of the Narcissistic Personality Inventory)
justification: “We assessed narcissism using the NPI-15… participants were given 15 pairs of phrases… The number of narcissistic responses was summed to form a narcissism score.”

measured_by: five-item choice satisfaction scale (Homburg et al., 2005)
justification: “Choice satisfaction was measured with five items (Homburg et al., 2005) both before (1) and after (2) participants read the message.”

measured_by: three-item pride of authorship scale (Franke et al., 2010)
justification: “Pride of authorship (three items; Franke et al., 2010) … were measured after participants had read the message.”
“Fit of configured options (one item; Till & Busler, 2000) were measured after participants had read the message.”
“Willingness to reconfigure one's car (one item) was measured after participants had read the message.”

measured_by: four-item car expertise scale adapted from Hildebrand et al., 2014
justification: “Participants … completed a four-item car expertise scale (adapted from Hildebrand et al., 2014).”
